member.summary: Occurs when a subreport is processed.

member.summary: Causes processing extensions and expressions in the report to be executed in the current .
member.param: An object containing security information about the report.

member.summary: Causes processing extensions and expressions to be executed in an application domain with limited permissions.

A class that can be used to read the report definition language (RDL) file for the subreport.

member.summary: Loads a subreport definition using a
member.param: The path and filename of the subreport definition.
A object that will contain the report definition language (RDL) for the subreport.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Reporting.WinForms.LocalReport.Refresh
member.summary: Causes the local report to be rendered with new data.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Reporting.WinForms.LocalReport.Render(System.String,System.String,Microsoft.Reporting.WinForms.CreateStreamCallback,Microsoft.Reporting.WinForms.Warning[]@)
member.summary: Processes the report and renders it in the specified format using a stream provided by a callback function.
member.param: A delegate function that will be used to provide a Stream object for rendering.

An XML string that contains the device-specific content that is required by the rendering extension specified in the format parameter. For more information about device information settings for specific output formats, see Device Information Settings.
The format in which to render the report. This argument maps to a rendering extension. Only the EXCEL format is supported in this release.
[out] An array of Warning[] objects that describes any warnings that occurred during report processing.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Reporting.WinForms.LocalReport.Render(System.String,System.String,System.String@,System.String@,System.String@,System.String[]@,Microsoft.Reporting.WinForms.Warning[]@)
member.summary: Processes the report and renders it in the specified format.
member.returns: A array of the report in the specified format.
member.param: [out] The filename extension used for the output file.
[out] The MIME type of the rendered report.

An XML string that contains the device-specific content that is required by the rendering extension specified in the format parameter. For more information about device information settings for specific output formats, see Device Information Settings.
The format in which to render the report. This argument maps to a rendering extension. Supported formats include Excel, PDF, and Image.
[out] The encoding used when rendering the contents of the report.
[out] The stream identifiers. You can use them to render external resources (images, for example) that are associated with the report.
[out] An array of Warning[] objects that describes any warnings that occurred during report processing.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Reporting.WinForms.LocalReport.SetParameters(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{Microsoft.Reporting.WinForms.ReportParameter})
member.summary: Sets report parameter properties for the local report.
member.param: An array of ReportParameter[] objects that contains a list of the report parameters properties.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Reporting.WinForms.LocalReport.DataSources
member.summary: Gets a collection of data sources used by the report.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Reporting.WinForms.LocalReport.EnableExternalImages
member.summary: Indicates whether the report can be rendered if it has external images.
member.returns: A Boolean value. A value of true indicates that the local report can be rendered if it has external images. The default value is false.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Reporting.WinForms.LocalReport.EnableHyperlinks
member.summary: Indicates whether the report can be rendered if it contains hyperlink actions.
member.returns: A Boolean value. A value of true indicates that the report can be rendered if it contains hyperlink actions. The default value is false.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Reporting.WinForms.LocalReport.OriginalParametersToDrillthrough
member.summary: Returns the parameters passed from a parent report to a drillthrough report.
member.returns: An array of objects in an IList collection, representing the parameters passed from the parent reports to the drillthrough report, or an empty collection if this report is not a drillthrough report.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Reporting.WinForms.ParameterState.DynamicValuesUnavailable
member.summary: The parameter values are unavailable. This state indicates that no valid, query-based values were returned as a result of the query.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Reporting.WinForms.ParameterState.HasOutstandingDependencies
member.summary: The parameter has outstanding dependencies. This generally occurs when the valid values or the default value of a parameter is query-based and dependencies exist that have not been submitted to the method.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Reporting.WinForms.ParameterState.HasValidValue
member.summary: A valid value for the parameter exists.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Reporting.WinForms.ParameterState.MissingValidValue
member.summary: A valid value for the parameter does not exist.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Reporting.WinForms.Report.Render(System.String,System.String,System.String@,System.String@,System.String@,System.String[]@,Microsoft.Reporting.WinForms.Warning[]@)
member.summary: Processes the report and renders it in the specified format.
member.returns: A array of the report in the specified format.
member.param: [out] The filename extension used for the output file.
[out] The MIME type of the rendered report.

An XML string that contains the device-specific content that is required by the rendering extension specified in the Format parameter. For more information about device information settings for specific output formats, see Device Information Settings.
The format in which to render the report. This argument maps to a rendering extension. Supported extensions include XML, NULL, CSV, IMAGE, PDF, HTML4.0, HTML3.2, MHTML, EXCEL, and HTMLOWC.
[out] The encoding used when rendering the contents of the report.
[out] The stream identifiers You can use them to render the external resources (images, etc.) that are associated with the report.
[out] An array of Warning[] objects that describes any warnings that occurred during report processing.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Reporting.WinForms.ReportServerCredentials.GetFormsCredentials(System.Net.Cookie@,System.String@,System.String@,System.String@)
member.summary: Returns a Boolean value indicating whether forms authentication will be used when connecting to the Report Server as well as information about the forms credentials to be used for authentication.
member.returns: Returns true if forms authentication is to be used when connecting to the Report Server. Information about the credentials to be used for forms authentication is returned via the out parameters used in the method call.
member.param: [out] The user name that will be used to connect to the Report Server..
[out] The authority to use when authenticating the user, for example, a Windows domain name.
[out] An authentication cookie used by the Report Server.
[out] The password that will be used to connect to the Report Server.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Reporting.WinForms.ReportServerCredentials.SetFormsCredentials(System.Net.Cookie,System.String,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Specifies that forms authentication is to be used when connecting to the Report Server, and provides the forms credentials.
member.param: The user name that will be used to connect to the Report Server..
The authority to use when authenticating the user, for example, a Windows domain name.
An authentication cookie used by the Report Server.
The password that will be used to connect to the Report Server.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Reporting.WinForms.ReportViewer.CancelRendering(System.Int32)
member.summary: Stops background processing of the report.
member.returns: A Boolean value. A value of true is returned if the background rendering has terminated. A value of false is returned if background rendering has not terminated after the amount of time specified in the millisecondsTimeout parameter has elapsed, or if the millisecondsTimeout parameter was set to 0.
member.param: The number of milliseconds to wait for the background rendering to terminate. A value of -1 waits forever. A value of 0 returns immediately without waiting for the rendering to terminate.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Reporting.WinForms.ReportViewer.Clear
member.summary: Clears the report view and fills it with the background color of the control.

The page number on which to start searching.

member.summary: Retrieves information about the data sources used for a report, including whether all required credentials have been supplied for the report data souces.
member.param: [out] Indicates whether all required credentials have been supplied for the data sources used by the server report.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Reporting.WinForms.ServerReport.GetDefaultPageSettings
member.summary: Gets the default page settings specified in the local report.
member.returns: A object containing the default page settings for the local report.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Reporting.WinForms.ServerReport.GetExecutionId
member.summary: Returns the current execution ID, or null if no execution ID is available.
member.returns: A String containing the execution ID.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Reporting.WinForms.ServerReport.GetParameters
member.summary: Returns report parameter properties for the report
member.returns: A object containing an array of ReportParameterInfo objects.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Reporting.WinForms.ServerReport.GetServerVersion
member.summary: Returns the version of the report server.
member.returns: A String value containing the server version information.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Reporting.WinForms.ServerReport.GetTotalPages
member.summary: Retrieves the total number of logical pages for the server report.
member.returns: An integer value containing the total number of logical pages in the report.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Reporting.WinForms.ServerReport.IsQueryExecutionAllowed
member.summary: Indicates whether the report can execute queries.
member.returns: A Boolean value indicating whether the report can execute queries.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Reporting.WinForms.ServerReport.ListRenderingExtensions
member.summary: Returns all available rendering extensions for the server report.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Reporting.WinForms.ServerReport.LoadReportDefinition(System.IO.TextReader)
member.summary: Loads the report definition from the report server using a .
member.param: A class that can be used to read the report definition language (RDL) file for the report.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Reporting.WinForms.ServerReport.Refresh
member.summary: Causes the report to be rendered with new data.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Reporting.WinForms.ServerReport.Render(System.String,System.String,System.String@,System.String@,System.String@,System.String[]@,Microsoft.Reporting.WinForms.Warning[]@)
member.summary: Processes the report and renders it in the specified format.
member.returns: A array of the report in the specified format.
member.param: [out] The filename extension used for the output file.
[out] The MIME type of the rendered report.

An XML string that contains the device-specific content that is required by the rendering extension specified in the format parameter. For more information about device information settings for specific output formats, see Device Information Settings.
The format in which to render the report. This argument maps to a rendering extension. Supported formats include Excel, PDF, and Image.
[out] The encoding used when rendering the contents of the report.
[out] The stream identifiers. You can use them to render external resources (images, for example) that are associated with the report.
[out] An array of Warning[] objects that describes any warnings that occurred during report processing.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Reporting.WinForms.ServerReport.RenderStream(System.String,System.String,System.String,System.String@,System.String@)
member.summary: Returns a secondary stream associated with a processed report.
member.returns: A Byte[] array of the stream in the specified format. For more information about this data type, see "Byte Structure" in the Microsoft .NET Framework documentation.
member.param: The MIME type of the stream.

An XML string that contains the device-specific content that is required by the rendering extension specified in the format parameter. For more information about device information settings for specific output formats, see Device Information Settings.
The format in which to render the stream. This argument maps to a rendering extension. Supported extensions include XML, NULL, CSV, IMAGE, PDF, HTML4.0, HTML3.2, MHTML, EXCEL, and HTMLOWC.
The .NET Framework encoding class name.
The stream identifier.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Reporting.WinForms.ServerReport.SetDataSourceCredentials(Microsoft.Reporting.WinForms.DataSourceCredentials[])
member.summary: Sets data source credentials for the report.
member.param: An array of objects.

member.summary: Initializes a server report using a specific report execution on the server.
member.param: A String containing the execution ID to use.

member.summary: Sets report parameter properties for the report.
member.param: An array of objects that contains a list of the report parameters properties.
